content:
Hi all!

I am designing a "User Input Language" and "Soft Typed Representation Language" to capture informal mathematical utterances (as part of my Ph.D. research). I am further investigating "translations" between the representation language and other formal languages to yield natural language input interfaces to LEAN 4, Isabelle, ATPs (TPTP), ..., and improve on the data exchange between ITPs/ATPs.

I will eventually have tools which perform these steps and wonder, how LEAN 4-understandable data can be sent to LEAN 4 for processing?

My question: Is it correct to think of a "plug-in tool and API design and integration into LEAN 4", or is there a dedicated way for such increments in LEAN 4, or else ... ?
(Couldn't find anything about plug-in/extension/... in the documentation)
I guess you don’t want to simply produce a Lean file and have it checked. If you want something a bit more interactive you can try https://github.com/leanprover-community/repl

Thank you very much for your reply.
Well I/O is ofc a solution, but doesn't scale well.
I thought the architecture is maybe layered and there is a dedicated way to integrate such a component.

I'll have a look at the link!

I'll tell you a use-case, why I do not favor I/O:
Informalizing (verbalizing) definitions and theorem statements is a lot easier than informalizing proofs.
For premise selection for Hammer tools, I envision streaming entire libraries of formal definitions and theorem statements. After heuristic premise selection, there are maybe a few combinations of thousands each to be considered.
what does any of that have to do with I/O?
Writing it out to read it in again is slow?

That's why I asked in the beginning, if an API design is desirable. I repeat myself, I don't know as much about the internals of LEAN 4, maybe there is a dedicated way for API integration. Therefore I asked.
LEAN 4 is interesting for me in this regard because I can imagine that macros and tactics can help with a premise selection heuristics. I would try it out if I come so far in the Ph.D. time :)
... Ph.D. time with Florian Rabe and Michael Kohlhase @ FAU Erlangen-Nuremberg... I already wondered where to properly introduce myself here on Zulipchat? Well, now I did it in a submarine-style. ;)
What more do you want than the API I linked to?

Christian Schöner said:

Writing it out to read it in again is slow?

Compared to type-checking Lean proofs, IO is (very) cheap

Patrick Massot schrieb:

What more do you want than the API I linked to?

Are there any features/addons for LEAN 4 from the development point of view planned for the near future? (You are willing to reveal)
I don't really understand your question and it's difficult to help you if you don't answer my question.
Ok then, thanks again for your kind replies. All questions answered! Have a good one. ;)
Christian Schöner has marked this topic as resolved.
